frameDefinitions: The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a Stimulus or about a Topic.
An Agent manipulates a Theme so that it ends up in a particular shape or configuration denoted by a Resultant_configuration.
An Exerter, Action, or Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target.
A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
A physical entity, construed as a point-Sound_source, emits a Sound.
This frame concerns people's knowledge or skill in certain domains.
frameExamples: Mr. Whiskers is <t>upset</t> that there are no more cat treats.
She <t>molded</t> the playdough into a ball.
Eugenie loved the sea and was a <t>strong</t> swimmer.
FE Layer-1: He is an <t>experienced</t> programmer.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the volitional actor who manipulates the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object which is manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> into a particular shape.
When the manipulation of the <fen>Theme</fen> takes place.
Where the manipulation of the <fen>Theme</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Action</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.

The frame element <fen>Sound_source</fen> is assigned to a constituent referring to a physical entity which emits a sound. Such an entity must have an appropriately complex internal structure such that it can create a sound. For example, a machine or some other thing with moving parts can create sound by itself.

The frame element <fen>Sound</fen> is incorporated in the meaning of the verbs of this frame. Otherwise, this role is assigned to NPs which actually refer to a sound in the presence of the target. This typically occurs when the target is a verb used as a modifier in its <ment>-ing</ment> form, e.g.:
An event in which one or more <fen>Sound_source</fen>s participate and which is accompanied by <fen>Sound</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Noisy_event</fen> occurs.

The location of the <fen>Sound_source</fen>. This role differs from <fen>Location_of_source</fen> only in terms of point of view; the latter role implies a point of view that is not on the <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
The person whose expertise is assessed.
<fen>Skill</fen> identifies the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s talent or ability to do things with one's hand or body.
The area of knowledge (as opposed to a practical skill) in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> 's experience is assessed.
A  product of behavior that shows the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s skill or lack of skill.

This frame element can only occur in place of a skill expression. It refers to the prototypical patient in an action involving the Protagonist. For instance, in the following sentence  the children are experts at some (contextually given) action such as rolling the hoops.

<fex name='Protagonist'>Some children</fex> <m>were</m> <fex name='Degree'>quite</fex> <t>expert</t> <fex name='Focal_participant'>with wooden hoops</fex>.
This frame element denotes a role in which the protagonist has developed his expertise.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> has the expertise.
listRoleExamples: Nan Ho turned, <fex>his</fex> extreme agitation unnoticed by the Prince.
I was angry <fex>about the war</fex>.
Liz's anger <fex>towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.
'Can I help you?' she asked, trying not to let him see the amusement <fex>in her blue eyes</fex>.
Tracy was in an irritated <fex>mood</fex>.
The end of the film was filled with jubilant <fex>scenes</fex>.
Salesmen touted the power <fex>of the engine's motor</fex>.
No one should underestimate the mighty <fex>strength</fex> of the dung beetle.
She gave him a playful, weak <fex>punch</fex> in the arm.
My quads feel particularly weak <fex>after 100 squats</fex>.
Muhammad Ali's force <fex>in the ring</fex> was indisputable.
<fex>Candlelight</fex> sparkled on the silverware.
Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
The fire <fex><t>glowed</t></fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
<fex>The wind</fex> howled.
The branches made a rattling <fex>sound</fex>.
<fex>The conversations</fex> droned on
It's going to beep again <fex>in two minutes</fex>.
A bat squeaked <fex>over our heads</fex>.
A skillful <fex>advertising campaign</fex> persuaded voters that his opponent was soft on crime.
His prowess <fex>as a surgeon</fex> is impressive.
